moves.1. Nf3: It seems to be an opening that gives Black the chance to decide the way of development but also it gives white many possibilities
moves.1... Nf6 2. c4: This is the possibility to continue with English opening or Queen Gambit
moves.2... c6 3. Nc3 d5 4. d4 dxc4 5. e4 Bg4 6: White is by now the owner of center and in the other hand it has the vantage in development
moves.6... b5 7. Bxf7+: Tipical sacrifice, in order to retard the Black's development and it stress the King
moves.7... Kxf7 8. Ne5+: ! The most of times Ng5  is better but I hope to recuperate the bishop
moves.8... Kg8: ?, bad choise, may be better 8. ... , Ke8, White Queen can fight the Black King for the rest of the game
moves.9. Qb3+ Nd5 10. Nxg4 e6 11. exd5 exd5: ? Althougth 11. ..., cxd5 loses a pawn, but Black needs to think about the King
moves.12. Ne3: ! the sacrifice of the horses will win, the magic consists on don't stop the attack
moves.12... a5: ?? I think Black can't see the big threat in progress
moves.14... g6: Finally Black makes something for its King but it's too late
moves.15. Nf4+: ! What a wonderful horse!, now the Queen is mine
Sorry horse but it was the easier way to win
Thanks to kgbsknik to let me reach the checkmate! I appreciate that
